title: Merlin results overshadowed by Alton Towers tragedy
text:
Merlin Entertainments has reported a 24% rise in pre-tax profits as it continues to deal with the fall-out of the accident at its Alton Towers Resort. The Smiler ride at Alton Towers 
Earlier this week the company issued a trading update, warning that full-year profits in its theme park division could be affected by as much as £47 million. 
Results for the 26 weeks to June 27 show an improvement on the prior year. 
Pre-tax profits rose from £40 million to £49 million, while operating profit was flat at £71 million. 
Visitor numbers increased by just under 1% to 27.7 million helping boost revenue to £544 million (+6%). 
Nick Varney, Merlin’s chief executive, said: “The first-half was overshadowed by the serious accident at Alton Towers. Safety is, and must always be, of paramount importance in our business. 
“We have iconic brands and a diversified portfolio and, thanks to our dedicated staff, continue to attain excellent satisfaction ratings from our customers. 
“These strengths enabled us to deliver a robust set of half year results and provide confidence in the medium and long term outlook.”
